page.title: 07THE BLACKER FAMILY-COLDHAYES
page.content: {COLONEL STEWART BLACKER}invented the{ {PIAT}anti-tank missile-also{HEDGEHOG,} the anti-submarine missile.Both these helped to win the Second World War.He also led the first flight over Everest He lived at Coldhayes,Steep Marsh,and died 1964.The present house is now owned by Mr Brian Blacker(son). Designed by Alfred Waterhouse,it was built in 1870 in the Gothic style by the Rev George Horsley-Palmer, the Brother of Earl of Selborne, a nearby village. The family have lived there from 1940.Until the Enclosures Act of 1856, the farmland which now surrounds the house was forest and yielded only clay for a local brick factory.Remains of this still exist.The farm covers about 100 acres,50 acres grazing and woodland, 50 acres crops. Coldhayes is open to the public, and the gardens are a local tourist attraction.
